As part of the operation of our website,: As part of the operation of our website, we collect and process information, some of which is described as "personal data". We undertake to comply with the regulations concerning the protection of personal data, namely the Data Protection and Freedoms Act No. 78-17 of 6 January 1978, as well as the European regulation 2016/679 "General Data Protection Regulation" of 27 April 2016.
Connection data is kept for a period of: Connection data is kept for a period of 15 days;

During a visit to our website, your brow: During a visit to our website, your browser automatically transmits us a certain amount of information, some of which is qualified as personal data.
In accordance with Article 15 of the Gen: In accordance with Article 15 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to obtain confirmation that personal data concerning you are or are not processed and, when they are processed, access to such data and the following information:
In accordance with Article 16 of the Gen: In accordance with Article 16 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to have your personal data corrected by the controller as soon as possible.
In accordance with Article 17 of the Gen: In accordance with Article 17 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to request the deletion of your personal data by the controller as soon as possible when one of the following reasons applies:
In accordance with Article 18 of the Gen: In accordance with Article 18 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to obtain from the controller the limitation of the processing of your personal data where one of the following reasons applies:
In accordance with Article 20 of the Gen: In accordance with Article 20 of the General Data Protection Regulation, you have the right to obtain from the controller a copy of the personal data concerning you that you have provided to him, in a structured format, commonly used and machine readable, when one of the following reasons applies:
In accordance with the General Data Prot: In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation, you have a number of rights regarding your personal data and the use made of it.
Processing is based on your consent;: Processing is based on your consent;
Processing is performed using automated: Processing is performed using automated processes.
The categories of personal data concerne: The categories of personal data concerned;
The concept of \"personal data\" means a: The concept of "personal data" means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person. A person is identifiable when he or she can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identification number or to one or more elements specific to him or her.
The controller no longer needs your pers: The controller no longer needs your personal data for the purposes of the processing, but it is still necessary for you to establish, exercise or defend legal rights;
The existence of the right to lodge a co: The existence of the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.
The existence of the right to request fr: The existence of the right to request from the controller the rectification or erasure of personal data concerning you, the right to request a limitation of their processing, or the right to object to such processing;
The legal basis for processing of person: The legal basis for processing of personal data we collect depends on the category to which it belongs, and are as follows:
The maximum retention period of the data: The maximum retention period of the data depends on the category to which it belongs, and are as follows:
The personal data we collect is hosted o: The personal data we collect is hosted on the technical infrastructure of our hosting provider:
The personal data we collect is intended: The personal data we collect is intended for the controller, its service providers, and any authority legally authorised to access the personal data in question.
The personal data we collect may be tran: The personal data we collect may be transferred outside the European Union to the technical infrastructure of our service providers:
The processing of connection data is bas: The processing of connection data is based on Article 6.1.c of the General Data Protection Regulation: «The processing is necessary to comply with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject». We collect this data in order to comply with the legal obligation to ensure the security of personal data and to prevent the destruction, loss, alteration, or unauthorised disclosure of such data. The collection of this data is mandatory.
The processing of contact data is based: The processing of contact data is based on Article 6.1.a of the General Data Protection Regulation: «The data subject has consented to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes». We collect and process this data in order to provide you with a response when we receive a message via our contact form. We collect your consent in the form of a check box on the contact form. Refusal of consent results in inability to use the functionality.
The processing of your personal data is: The processing of your personal data is unlawful, you oppose their deletion and instead demand the limitation of its use;
The purpose of this document is to infor: The purpose of this document is to inform you about how we collect and use your personal data, as well as the means at your disposal to control its use.
The recipients to whom the personal data: The recipients to whom the personal data has been or will be communicated;
The retention period of this data, or if: The retention period of this data, or if it is not known, the criterion for defining it;
To exercise these rights, you may contac: To exercise these rights, you may contact us specifying the nature of the right you wish to exercise and the reasons why you wish to exercise it:
We do not collect or process any sensiti: We do not collect or process any sensitive data. The following are considered to be sensitive data within the meaning of the General Data Protection Regulation: Racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, union membership, health data or sexual orientation.
We ensure that we only work with compani: We ensure that we only work with companies that protect your personal data and comply with applicable law in the same way we do. In accordance with Article 28 of the General Data Protection Regulation, access to your personal data by our service providers is subject to the signature of a written agreement that allows us to monitor and control the way they process your personal data.
We implement all applicable technical an: We implement all applicable technical and organisational measures to ensure the security of the personal data we collect.
We may ask you for additional informatio: We may ask you for additional information, such as proof of identity, in order to guarantee the protection of your personal data.
We may collect personal data in the foll: We may collect personal data in the following ways:
We may collect the following categories: We may collect the following categories of personal data:
When you visit our website, you may take: When you visit our website, you may take a number of actions, some of which require you to provide us with information qualified as personal data. This is for example the case if you send us a message via the contact form.
You dispute the accuracy of your persona: You dispute the accuracy of your personal data. The processing shall then be suspended for a period allowing the controller to verify its accuracy;
You object to the processing of your per: You object to the processing of your personal data and there is no compelling legitimate reason for its retention;
You objected to the processing of your p: You objected to the processing of your personal data. The processing shall then be suspended during the verification to determine whether the legitimate reasons pursued by the controller prevail over yours.
You withdraw the consent on which the pr: You withdraw the consent on which the processing of your personal data is based and there is no other legal basis for the processing of your personal data;
Your personal data has been unlawfully p: Your personal data has been unlawfully processed;
Your personal data is no longer necessar: Your personal data is no longer necessary for the purposes for which it was collected;
Your personal data must be deleted to co: Your personal data must be deleted to comply with a legal obligation.
